seasonal_context.typical_patterns: Trade wind swells, occasional Southern Hemisphere swells

buoy_analysis.narrative: Limited buoy data available. Buoy 51001 offline for maintenance. Buoy 51201 shows mixed signal: 3-5ft @ 8-12s from variable directions (160-210°). Spectral analysis indicates overlapping short-period windswell and possible long-period S swell component, but separation uncertain. Buoy 51004 (Southeast) shows 4ft @ 10s from 180° but data quality flagged due to sensor issues. Low confidence due to sparse, conflicting observations.

pressure_analysis.narrative: Southern Hemisphere analysis shows weak low-pressure system (992 mb) at 50°S, 170°W on July 17, but fetch window limited (<400 nm) and winds marginal (25-30 kt). Wave period charts show possible 12-14s energy but signal weak and timing uncertain (July 20-22 range). Competing trade wind pattern may mask or interfere with S swell. Model consensus low. Moderate-low confidence in S swell arrival.

contradictions.issue: Buoy data too variable to confirm pressure forecast
contradictions.resolution: Acknowledge uncertainty, provide range instead of specific prediction

key_findings: Limited buoy data due to offline sensors
Weak Southern Hemisphere system with marginal fetch
High uncertainty in swell arrival timing and size
Trade winds may dominate or interfere with S swell signal
Recommend conservative forecast with wide error bars
